turns.speaker: L.T.
turns.text: Well that's why I'm here, Mr. Dean. 'Cause you're a labor lawyer.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Good point.

turns.speaker: L.T.
turns.text: Last night, Larry Spinks, he works the Steel Press, he goes to a bar with his wife Rosalie to have a glass of chianti 'cause it's his birthday, and these two guys, these Guido mother-fuckers, they jump him when he goes to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: L.T., in this office I'd prefer you say Italian-Americans.

turns.speaker: L.T.
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Dean. But Larry's in St. Lukes now, so I'm a little--I'm not myself. The Union bosses say unless we take Bellmoth's offer, it'll only get worse.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: That's because your Union bosses <u>are</u> those Guido mother-fuckers.

turns.speaker: L.T.
turns.text: I don't under--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: The Union's trying to railroad you into accepting terms worse than what you have now.

turns.speaker: L.T.
turns.text: Why would the Union--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Because they've been paid off by Bellmoth.

turns.speaker: L.T.
turns.text: Mr. Dean--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: My name's Bobby. I'm your lawyer. Don't do anything 'till I talk to you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Robert--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Where's Stacy?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: She doesn't want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What are you talking--

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: She can't talk to you right now.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Because she's reading the newspaper, you asshole.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Excuse me, have any of you seen an eight year old boy, good looking, about yea-big.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Hi, dad.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You're learning a cruel lesson.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Are those my Christmas presents?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Some of 'em.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Can I open 'em up?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Sure, go ahead.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: In your dreams.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You staying for dinner?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: He's kidding.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Where's mom?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: She's in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Where've you been?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Having an adventure. I can't tell you about it right now, but I'll tell you about it soon.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Are you and mom getting a divorce?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No. We're never getting a divorce. We were having a fight. It happens sometimes.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Who won the fight?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Men don't win fights with women, son, I'll tell you about that sometime, too. In the meantime, I've got a question for you, and it's incredibly important that you tell me the truth. Under no circumstances will I be angry with you. This is a total Get-Out-Of- Jail-Free card. Ready?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Did you take <u>anything</u>--anything at all--out of those Christmas bags I brought home last week.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: How long can you stay?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm not goin' anywhere, Eric. I live here.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's okay to use the phone.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Alright!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No "900" numbers.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: They took the espresso machine. The espresso machine, Jerry! Which makes sense, you know, because the crooks probably wanted to make themselves a latte before fencing the stereo.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Did they take your clothes?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You've got a bunch of Armani suits, they didn't take 'em?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Usually they take clothes.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Why don't you give 'em a call.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What about jewelry?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: They didn't take the jewelry. They took the computers. They took the big-screen TV, they took my blender.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The blender?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I love my blender.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They didn't take the silverware?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No, but they took my blender.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sounds like they didn't want anything that wasn't electric?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They only took electrical appliances.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Serve the ball.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Can I talk to you a second?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Table 122?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's what I want to talk to you about?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I wrote a check for a thousand dollars. You guys didn't have a table that was in the kitchen?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The Congressman's very happy to have your support, but he's heard that there's an investigation.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: An investigation? It was a bus accident.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He's heard that it's escalated.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Into what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Your Bellmoth case. The FBI thinks there might be mob ties.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm a labor lawyer. There are <u>always</u> mob ties.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Just be cool.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Jerry--

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Christ!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Ssh!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bobby--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's the NSA. They're the ones doing this.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bobby--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: The NSA's doing this 'cause they think I have something. And they killed--

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Calm down.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: They killed Rachel.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Rachel's dead?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: My stuff's all over her apartment.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bobby--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: They're framing me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Why would they--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know. I mean--

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Why would the NSA--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're tired.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Jerry--

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Listen to me.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You gotta--

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, listen to me. You gotta let me bring you in.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No, I--

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You gotta let me bring you in to the police.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I won't <u>make</u> it to the police. They won't let me get there. You go.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: To the cops?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: To the NSA. Make a deal. Tell 'em to stop. Tell 'em I don't have what they're after. Make a deal.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bobby, you're in way over your head.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Go to 'em, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I have a family.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: So do I!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm sorry, man.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No. No, it's okay.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bobby? Piece of advice?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Turn yourself in.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Go fuck yourself.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's me, Robert Dean.  From Seth, Silverberg. I worked on--

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: Bobby--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's been a few years.

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm just doing some Christmas shopping. It's for my wife, no kidding. Though, this isn't the main present, it's just, you know, a little--

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: I need help.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: How can I reach you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: Are you still in Crystal City?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Yeah, what's going on?

turns.speaker: LEVIN
turns.text: Dick Burns got a phone call this morning from someone wanting information on you.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: The police?

turns.speaker: LEVIN
turns.text: No. He said they were doing a credit check. Are you refinancing a loan?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You remember Daniel Zavitz?

turns.speaker: LEVIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: He got hit by a bus.

turns.speaker: LEVIN
turns.text: What does that have to do with you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I honestly don't know.

turns.speaker: LEVIN
turns.text: Was Zavitz in trouble?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LEVIN
turns.text: You think there was a connection to--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Jesus! I just told you. I don't know.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: What is it you want?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Someone's trying to destroy my life, and I'd like to find out who.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Well we'd sure like to help you.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You would?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Yes. But we can't.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Because we, and our associates, have paid out hundreds of thousands of dollars to shyster lawyers like you, <u>because</u> of shyster lawyers like you, and we'd just as soon sit back and sip a beer while you get ass-banged by as many people as possible.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What's your opinion?

turns.speaker: FIEDLER
turns.text: It's hard to say for certain, these things are--

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I'm not asking you to say for certain. This is what you're trained to do, right?

turns.speaker: FIEDLER
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Then what's your goddam opinion?

turns.speaker: FIEDLER
turns.text: Zavitz had digital compression equipment. He could've downloaded into something. A disk, a chip, anything small enough to put in his pocket and run with. Whatever he put it in, he dropped it in that bag.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Get it.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: "I know thy works and thy labour and how thou canst not bear them that are evil. And thou hast tried them who say they are apostles and hast found them to be liars". Revelations II.

turns.speaker: HAMERSLEY
turns.text: What the hell does it mean?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: It means who's side are you on?

turns.speaker: HAMERSLEY
turns.text: You didn't ask me to meet you 30 miles from my office for a Bible study class.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: It's a bi-partisan issue. Everyone needs to swallow hard. No one, including you, wants to be fingered as the one obstructing efforts to crack down on terrorism, and--

turns.speaker: HAMERSLEY
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HAMERSLEY
turns.text: I said fuck you.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Is that anyway to talk to an old school chum?

turns.speaker: HAMERSLEY
turns.text: You're gonna finger me as soft on terrorism? Terrorism, you unconscionable asshole?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: There are planes falling out of the sky, buildings blowing up. American buildings. Americans getting bombs in the mail. What are we gonna do!?

turns.speaker: HAMERSLEY
turns.text: We're not gonna hand you and your band of lunatics the keys to the kingdom. I'm not gonna sit in Congress and write a law that allows the NSA to point a camera and a microphone at anything they damn well feel like. And the next time you have something to say to me, we do it above-board, in my office, like everyone else. Now get outa my car, I've got a committee meeting on the hill.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: He's dead. An accident. Hit by a bus.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What about the tapes?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We found the originals.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: The originals?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: There was a transfer.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Am I to understand--

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: He never made it to the newspaper, but there was private sector contact.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Several indiscriminates and one primary who we've ID'd as Robert Dean. A Crystal City attorney.  Mr. Reynolds?  Sir?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Contact COINTEL. Profile. Assess the threat. Then cross-check against Zavitz. Red-flag the intersects and anything we can exploit. Also NRO. Pull up the keyhole tapes. I need to own him. I need to own him <u>now</u>.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We'd have to--

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Get it.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: He's arrogant and threatening. Voice stress points suggest he's worrying.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Hiding something?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: It was in his bag. Now it's not.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Destroy his credibility before he goes public. Neutralize him. I don't want anyone listening to a word he has to say. Tell me about Rachel Banks.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: 30 minutes ago you said we had him. What in hell's goin' on out there?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: He had help.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Help from whom?  Christ.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I sit on top of the greatest intelligence gathering organization in human history. Why can't I bring in a man whose name is in the fucking phonebook?!

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: He's clever. He had help.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: He's clever? He had help?  Oh.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Sir--

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: No, no, I'm sorry. I didn't realize you were hoping to be transferred to a weathership outside Greenland.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: I just meant--

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I don't care if he's Solomon with Saint Joseph sitting in his <u>lap</u>. I want the tape and I want him. Now is--

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We found two sets of latent prints in the rubble of Brill's studio. One was Dean's. The other, we believe, belongs to Brill.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: We believe?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Well...his real name's Edward Lyle.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Lyle?!

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: You're kidding me.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: No sir.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Dean's with Lyle.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: And they have the video. That's confirmed.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: So they know everything.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: If they've looked at the video.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Oh, let's assume that they have.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: If he's with Lyle it means he's got resources.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Resources, that's a good point. He's got resources. All we've got is a six-hundred billion dollar organization! Now goddammit, Hicks, you find 'em. You find 'em and you end it now!

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What about--

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We don't know.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Explain that.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Jones had to flee the scene before we could locate the second body.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What about the tape?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We think it was on Brill. If it was, it's destroyed now.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: And if it wasn't?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Found him. Kent Island nailed the call five minutes ago. He's stationary.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Do you have visual?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Not yet. He's near "M" and 34th. I've got an ELSUR unit on the scene now. A residential building. Twelve units.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What's your ETA?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Three minutes. We're going in light. Myself and two others. Everyone else is held back in reserve.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: He walked right up to me in church. At the holiest time of the wear. He approached me in a sanctified place.  Kill him now.

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Federal Express for 'Zavitz'.

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: Federal Express?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: For Daniel Zavitz. I just need a signature.

turns.speaker: ZAVITZ
turns.text: How'd you get in the building?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: The door was open, sir. I just need a signature.

turns.speaker: SHAFFER
turns.text: We're not stupid, Reynolds.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: The fuck do you have goin' on with Sam Albert?

turns.speaker: SHAFFER
turns.text: This guy's carrying the <u>flag</u> for the damn terrorism bill. You think this is the best time to piss him off?

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: You have any idea what kind of position this--

turns.speaker: SHAFFER
turns.text: He's carrying the damn <u>flag</u>.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: It was pulsing on your SAT frequencies.

turns.speaker: SHAFFER
turns.text: I don't know what's going on, but if you people have tripped over your own asshole again, you're not gonna get any help from us. It's ending at your doorstep.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Puffed cheese?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: I also have tiny pizzas and mushrooms stuffed with--

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Do I look like I want a tiny pizza?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Then let's assume I don't.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Now is that clear?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I wanted to meet a man who could write such a long paper with so few adjectives.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: A thing is still a thing no matter what you place in front of it.  Big car, slow car, chauffeur-driven car, still a car.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Isn't Zerzura supposed to be protected by spirits who take on the shape of sandstorms?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What kind of fossils?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I can't sing.  but I can tell a story.  I might need a prompt.  Do you have your Herodotus?  I've noticed you carry it

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I'm sorry - what have you noticed?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Daskylus

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Yes, thank you, Gyges, son of Daskylus - Candaules said to him I don't think you believe me when I tell you how beautiful my wife is. And although Gyges replied he did find the Queen magnificent the King insisted he would find some way to prove beyond dispute that she was fairest of all women.  Do you all know this story?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: How much did you pay?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Hello!  Good morning.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: They don't see foreign women in this market.  How much did you pay?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Seven pounds, eight, I suppose. Why?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Which stall?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: You've been cheated, don't worry, we'll take it back.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I don't want to go back.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: This is not worth eight pounds, Mrs. Clifton.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I don't care to bargain.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: That insults them.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I don't believe that.  I think you are insulted by me, somehow. You're a foreigner too, aren't you, here, in this market?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I should be very happy to obtain the correct price for this.  I apologize if I appear abrupt.  I am rusty at social graces.  How do you find Cairo?  Did you visit the Pyramids?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Why did you follow me yesterday?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: After the market, you followed me to the hotel.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I was concerned.  As I said, women in that part of Cairo, a European women, I felt obliged to.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You felt obliged to.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: As the wife of one of our party.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: So why follow me?  Escort me, by all means.  Following me is predatory, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: This is an incredible story - about a man hunting an Ostrich, he's been telling me about Zerzura, he thinks he's been there, but his map, the route he's describing, he couldn't survive the journey now, but he's a poet, so his map is poetry - and now we're onto an Ostrich.  I'm telling her your map is poetry. The Arab shrugs.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: What do you mean, poetry?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: A mountain curved like a woman's back, a plateau the shape of an ear.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Sounds perfectly clear.  Where does the Ostrich come in?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: The Ostrich is a detour.  A poor man hunts an ostrich, it's the method.  Nothing to do with Zerzura.  To catch an ostrich you must appear not to move.  The man finds a place where the ostrich feeds, a wadi, and stands where the ostrich can see him, on the horizon, and doesn't move, doesn't eat - otherwise the ostrich will run.  At nightfall, he moves, fifty, sixty yards.  When the ostrich comes the next day, the man is there, but he's nearer.  Haunting the ostrich.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: What is he saying?  Come on, what did he say?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: He said - be careful.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Be careful?  You mean you - or me? Who?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Her or me?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Actually, you sing.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Pardon?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You sing.  All the time.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I do not.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Ask Al Auf. Almásy asks Al Auf in Arabic.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I thought you might paste them into your book.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: We took several photographs, there's no need.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I'd like you to have them.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: There's really no need.  This is just a scrapbook.  I should feel obliged.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: And that would be unconscionable, I suppose, to feel any obligation? Yes.  Of course it would.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: You should come into the shelter.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I'm quite all right, thank you.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Look over there.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: What am I looking at?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: See what's happening to them - the stars.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: They're so untidy.  I'm just trying to rearrange them.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: In an hour there will be no stars. The air is filling with sand.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: This is not very good, is it?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Shall we be all right?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Yes.  Absolutely.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Yes is a comfort.  Absolutely is not.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: - there is the Harmattan, a red wind. Which Mariners called the sea of darkness.  Red sand from this wind has flown as far as the south coast of England, producing showers so dense they were mistaken for blood. Almasy checks to see if Katharine is still awake.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Fiction.  We had a house on that coast and it never rained blood. Go on.  More.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: All true.  Herodotus, your friend, tells of a wind - the Simoon - so evil that a nation declared war on it and marched out to fight it in full battle dress, their swords raised.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Madox will have calculated how many miles, they'll soon turn around.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Oh my God, the others!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Could I ask you, please, to paste you paintings into my book?  I should like to have them.  I should be honored.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Of course.  Is it, am I a terrible coward to ask how much water we have?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Water?  Yes, we have water, we have a little in our can, we have water in the radiator which can be drunk. Not at all cowardly, extremely practical.  Come on, come on!  There's also a plant - I've never seen it but I'm told you can cut a piece the size of a heart from this plant and the next day it will be filled with a delicious liquid.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Find that plant.  Cut out its heart.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Geoffrey's not in Cairo.  He's not actually a buffoon.  And the plane wasn't a wedding present. It belongs to the British Government.  They want aerial maps of the whole North Africa. So I think he's in Ethiopia.  In case you were counting on his sudden appearance.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: And the marriage - is that a fiction?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: No, the marriage isn't a fiction.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Do they know them?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No, but I think I do.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Will you not come in?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Will you please come in?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Mrs. Clifton - Katharine turns, disgusted.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Don't.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I believe you still have my book.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I'm impressed you can sew.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You sew very badly.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: You don't sew at all!

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: A woman should never learn to sew, and if she can she should never admit to it.  Close your eyes.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: That makes it harder still.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: When were you most happy?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: When were you least happy?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Okay.  And what do you love? Say everything.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: What do I love?  I love rice pudding, and water, the fish in it, hedgehogs! The gardens at our house in Freshwater - all my secret paths.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Marmite - addicted!  Baths - not with other people!  Islands.  Your handwriting.  I could go on all day.  My husband. Almásy nods.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What do you hate most?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: A lie.  What do you hate most?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Ownership.  Being owned.  When you leave, you should forget me.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Say you're sick.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: What?  No!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Say you're feeling faint - the sun.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I can't work.  I can't sleep. Lady Hampton calls impatiently.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I can still taste you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: This is empty, just coming!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I'm trying to write with your taste in my mouth.  Swoon.  I'll catch you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: This is - what is this?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: It's a folk song.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Arabic?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No, no, it's Hungarian.  My daijka sang it to me.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: It's beautiful.  What's it about?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: It's a long song - Szerelem means loveand the story - there's a Hungarian Count, he's a wanderer, a fool.  For years he's on some kind of quest, who knows what? And then one day he falls under the spell of a mysterious English woman - a harpy - who beats him and hits him and he becomes her slave.  He sews her clothes, he worships the hem of -

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Ouch!  See - you're always beating me..!

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You bastard, I was believing you!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: This - what's it called? - this place, I love it - this is mine!  I'm asking the King permission to call it the Almasy Bosphorous.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I thought we were against ownership?  I can stay tonight.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Madox knows, I think.  He's tried to warn me.  He keeps talking about Anna Karenina.  I think it's his idea of a man-to-man chat.  Its my idea of a man-to-man chat.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: This is a different world - is what I tell myself.  A different life. And here I am a different wife.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Yes.  A different wife.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I don't care to bargain.  It's full of saffron, just in case you think I'm giving it to you to encourage your sewing.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: That day, had you followed me to the market?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Of course.  You didn't need to slap my face to make me feel as if you'd slapped my face.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Shall we be all right?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Yes.  Yes.  Absolutely.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I'd better get back.  Say goodbye here.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I'm not agreeing.  Don't think I'm agreeing, because I'm not.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I just know - any minute he'll find out, we'll barge into somebody we'll - and it will ill him.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Don't go over it again, please.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I just wanted you to know. I'm not missing you yet. She nods, can't find this funny.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You will.  You will.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Why did you hold his collar?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What?  What?  That boy, that little boy, you were holding his collar, gripping his collar, what for?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Would you let me pass?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Is he next?  Do you drag him into your little room?  Where is it?  Is this it?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Don't do this.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I've watched you - on verandahs, at Garden Parties, at the Races - how can you stand there?  How can you ever smile?  As if your life hadn't capsized?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You know why? He tries to hold her. She resists

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Dance with me.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Dance with me.  I want to touch you. I want the things which are mine. Which belong to me.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Do you think you're the only one who feels anything?  Is that what you think?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Katharine!  Oh dear God, Katharine - what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I can't move.  I can't get out.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Why did he bring you?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: A surprise, he said.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Please don't move me.  It hurts too much.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: We've got to get you out of here.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: It hurts too much.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I know, darling, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Why did you hate me?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Don't you know you drove everybody mad?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Don't talk.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: You speak so many bloody languages and you never want to talk.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: You're wearing the thimble.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Of course.  You idiot.  I always wear it. I've always worn it.  I've always loved you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: It's so cold.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I know.  I'm sorry.  I'll make a fire. I'll be back.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Don't leave me!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I'm just going to find things for the fire.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Shall we be all right?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Yes.  Absolutely.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Oh dear.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Listen to me, Katharine.  You've broken your ankle and I'm going to have to try and bind it.  I think your wrist might be broken, too - and some ribs, which is why it's hurting you to breathe.  I'm going to have to walk to El Taj.  Given all the traffic in the desert these days I should bump into one army or another before I reach there - or Fenelon-Barnes and his camel.  And then I'll be back and we'll be fine, and I'll never leave you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Do you promise?  I wouldn't want to die here.  I wouldn't want to die in the desert. I've always had a rather elaborate funeral in mind, with particular hymns.  Very English.  And I know exactly where I want to be buried.  In our garden.  Where I grew up. With a view of the sea.  So promise me you'll come back for you.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I promise I'll come back.  I promise I'll never leave you.  And there's plenty of water and food. You can have a party.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: And a good read.  Don't waste it.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Thank you.  Will you bury Geoffrey?  I know he's dead.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Katharine.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Every night I cut out my heart but in the morning it was full again.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Tell me about your garden.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: Our Garden, our garden - not so much the garden, but the copse alongside it, wild, a secret way plunging down to the shore and then nothing but water between you and France.  The Devil's Chimney it was called -  The Devil's Chimney, I don't know why.  Darling.  My darling.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: A broken car?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Still a car.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Uxoriousness - that's my favorite kind of love.  Excessive love of one's wife.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: There you have me.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What kind of photographs?

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Portraits.  The Brigadier, the Brigadier's wife, the Brigadier's dogs, the Brigadier at the Pyramids, the Brigadier breathing.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Safe journey.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: You too.  Good luck!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Clifton - your wife - do you think it's appropriate to leave her?

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Appropriate?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I think the desert is, it's - for a woman - it's very tough, I wonder if it's not too much for her.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Are you mad?  Katharine loves it here. She told me yesterday.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: All the same, I, were I you I would be concerned -

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: I've known Katharine since she was three, my aunt is her aunt, we were practically brother and sister before we were man and wife.  I think I'd know what is and what isn't too much for her.  I think she's know herself.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Why are you people so threatened by a woman?!

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Have you seen Katharine?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: It's Geoffrey under this.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I haven't, no.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Oops!  Mustn't say International. Dirty word.  Filthy word.  His Majesty! Die Führer!  Il Duce.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Sorry, what's your point?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: And the people here don't want us. Are you kidding?  The Egyptians are desperate to get rid of the Colonials  - isn't that right? Their best people get down on hands and knees begging to be spared a knighthood.  Isn't that right?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Good morning!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Could I trouble you for some water?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Yes, of course.  So, golly, where have you come from?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I desperately need a jeep.  There's been an accident.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No, I'm not thinking clearly - I need a doctor too, to come with me, can I take this vehicle?  I'll pay, of course - and some morphine and  Seventy miles - I can be back here by dusk.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Do you have your papers, sir?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: If I could just see some identification.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Am I not talking sense? -  forgive me, I'm, I've been walking, I've - there's a woman badly injured at Gilf Kebir, in the Cave of Swimmers.  I am a member of the Royal Geographical Society.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Right.  And what's your name, sir?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Count Laszlo de Almásy. The Officer is writing this down.  A glance at his Corporal.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Almásy - would you mind just spelling that for me?  What nationality would that be?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Look, listen to me.  A woman is dying - my wife! - is dying seventy miles from here.  I have been walking for three days!  I don't want to spell my name, I want you to give me this jeep!

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: I understand you are agitated - perhaps you would like to sit down while I radio back to HQ -

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No!  NO!  Don't radio anybody, just give me the fucking jeep!

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: What did you think you were doing in his tent?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Looking for the fossils.  Why should we wait until we're in London?  This girl was probably twelve years old.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: You shouldn't go into another man's tent. It's inexcusable.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Her hands and feet were tied.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: What did you do?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I looked at them.  They're shrubs, small trees.  Exquisite.  And fossilized, rock hard. He walks away to the nose of the plane.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: I was talking about the girl.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Cut the ropes.  I left a note, on his blanket.  At the next Geographical Society I shall await with great interest the announcement of the Fenelon-Barnes Slave Knot.  The Girl wouldn't leave, of course.  Her father had sold her for a camel. He turns over the propeller, the engine cranks up.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: I'll be back as quick as I can. Thirty-six hours at the outside.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Try to get a second radiator, we'll bury it between here and the Pottery Hill. And a better jack. We planned badly.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Bermann!

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: And I'm telling you there's nothing there to explore.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: No, because you can't see from the air! If you could explore from the air life would be very simple!  Look!  What is that?  Is that a wadi? That whole spur is a real possibility

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Which we've overflown twice.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Which we couldn't explore because of rocks, because of cross-winds, it's sloppy.  And here - and here - we could be staring at Zerzura.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: And where are the Expedition Maps?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: In my room.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Those maps belong to His Majesty's Government.  They're confidential. They shouldn't be left lying around for any Tom, Dick or Mary to have sight of.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Don't be so bloody naïve.  You know there's a war breaking out.  This arrived this morning.  By order of the British Government - all International Expeditions to be aborted by May 1939.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Why do they care about our maps?

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: What do we find in the desert? Arrow heads, spears.  In a war, if you own the desert, you own North Africa.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Own the desert.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I believe I'm rather late.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Good, we're all here?  A toast, to the International Sand club - may it soon resurface.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Look, either shut up, or go home.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Absolutely right, shut up. Lashings of apologies all round.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Had a letter from my wife.  The wisteria is still out, which I'm looking forward to.  She says Dorset is gripped with Invasion Fever.  Wrong coast I should have thought, still

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: Bermann thinks he'll be interned, poor fellow.  I'm going to do what I can, but  And D'Ag turns out to be a great admirer of Mussolini. So now you can say I told you so.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: I told you so.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: We didn't care about countries. Did we?  Brits, Arabs, Hungarians, Germans.  None of that mattered, did it?  It was something finer than that.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Yes.  It was.  Thanks for the compass. I'll look after it for you.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: When's Clifton picking you up?

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Tomorrow afternoon.  Don't worry. I'll be ready.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: I'll leave the plane in the hangar at Kufra Oasis.  So if you need ithard to know how long one's talking about.  We might all be back in a month or two.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: I have to teach myself not to read too much into everything.  Comes of too long having to read so much into hardly anything at all.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Goodbye, my friend. They shake hands.

turns.speaker: MADOX
turns.text: May God make safety your companion.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: There is no God.  But I hope someone looks after you.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Hey!  Hey!  Stop this jeep!  Let me out of here - there's a woman dying, there's a woman dying while I'm - Hey!

turns.speaker: CORPORAL
turns.text: Shut-up!

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Please - I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, please listen to me, this is a terrible mistake. Just stop, please, and listen to me.  My wife is dying.

turns.speaker: CORPORAL
turns.text: Listen, Fritz, if I have to listen to another word from you I'll give you a fucking good hiding.

turns.speaker: ALMÁSY
turns.text: Fritz?  What are you talking about? Who's Fritz?

turns.speaker: CORPORAL
turns.text: That's your name innit?  Count Fucking Arsehole Von Bismarck? What's that supposed to be then, Irish?

turns.speaker: HANA
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: HANA
turns.text: Your leg will be fine.  A lot of shrapnel came out - I saved you the pieces.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: You're the prettiest girl I ever saw.

turns.speaker: HANA
turns.text: No, I'll get you some tea. Wait till you're in Naples.  You'll find a girl there.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Just kiss me.  It would mean such a lot to me.

turns.speaker: HANA
turns.text: Would it? She kisses him, very softly, on the lips.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MÜLLER
turns.text: David Caravaggio.

turns.speaker: CARAVAGGIO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MÜLLER
turns.text: Petty thief, six months imprisonment Kingston Penitentiary, 1937.

turns.speaker: CARAVAGGIO
turns.text: I keep explaining.  You've got the wrong man.  My name is Bellini - Antonio Bellini.  Bellini, Caravaggio, both painters, I think that is confusing you.
